oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Study of alloy dissolution, passivity and protective coatings by electrochemical impedance spectroscopy
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: RAJA, VS
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: corrosion behavior
metals
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The importance of the application of electrochemical impedance spectroscopy (EIS) for corrosion research is highlighted. Examples involving activation of In in Al-alloy sacrificial anodes, improvement of passivity in stainless steels weldments by N addition and deterioration of organic protective coatings are provided to illustrate various aspects involved in analysis of EIS data.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: TRANSACTIONS OF THE INDIAN INSTITUTE OF METALS, 51(5), 351-357
